column3:
Concept ACK, I'd be happier adding extensions to the scripts or renaming the extension when it's a rare one (e.g. '.bash' => change to '.sh').

The interpreter is meant to be defined in the first line of the script,
not in its extension.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

Rebased c6f7b89405a42248769750ed60367ae81c48d084 -> 93a7c376c78a015871285987a9ef0da518d809d4 ([pr23506.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr23506.01) -> [pr23506.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr23506.02)) due to the conflict with #23462.
Concept ACK! I'm guessing `shellcheck` does not work with relative paths for the `source=` directive?
> I'm guessing `shellcheck` does not work with relative paths for the `source=` directive?\n\nIt seems `shellcheck` tries to resolve them relatively to its own directory.

Concept ACK

> and it fixes discovered shellcheck warnings.

What warnings are being fixed here? Looks like it's just updating the `source=` directives?

> > and it fixes discovered shellcheck warnings.
> 
> What warnings are being fixed here? Looks like it's just updating the `source=` directives?

For instance:
```sh
$ test/lint/lint-shell.sh 

In contrib/guix/guix-attest line 10:
source "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/libexec/prelude.bash"
       ^-- SC1091: Not following: libexec/prelude.bash: openBinaryFile: does not exist

@hebasto Did you look into if it'd be possible to do relative to script path? I'm seeing on the man page that you can use a `source-path` directive? I'm just thinking it might make it easier if we were to rename directories in the future to not have to touch all the `source=` directives

```bash
./test/lint/lint-all.sh
....
In contrib/guix/guix-clean line 37:
    path_residue="${2##${1}}"
                       ^--^ SC2295 (info): Expansions inside ${..} need to be quoted separately, otherwise they match as patterns.

Did you mean: 
    path_residue="${2##"${1}"}"

For more information:
  https://www.shellcheck.net/wiki/SC2295 -- Expansions inside ${..} need

@fanquake 

> ```shell
> ./test/lint/lint-all.sh
> ....
> In contrib/guix/guix-clean line 37:
>     path_residue="${2##${1}}"
>                        ^--^ SC2295 (info): Expansions inside ${..} need to be quoted separately, otherwise they match as patterns.
> 
> Did you mean: 
>     path_residue="${2##"${1}"}"
> 
> For more information:
>   https://www.shellcheck.net/wik
Code Review ACK a3f61676e83e908da67664c6163db61d1d11c5d2, this is a good robustness improvement for our shell scripts.
crACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23506/commits/a3f61676e83e908da67664c6163db61d1d11c5d2\n\nIntroduces shellcheck coverage, passes CI - sounds good to me.
